intro: Oldenlandia obbiadensis, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often with prominent bracts. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or along stream banks.
